gen

Class PositionHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • gen.PositionHelper

  • public class PositionHelper
extends Object
    This class provides methods to compute the probability of a REORDER transition and to get the takeBestN-best REORDER transitions as defined in the thesis (Section 4.2.1 Modeling).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double maxProbDecrement 
      int takeBestN

      • PositionHelper

        public PositionHelper(ParentChildReorderMaxentModel parentChildReorderMaxentModel,
                      SiblingReorderMaxentModel leftMaxEnt,
                      SiblingReorderMaxentModel rightMaxEnt)
        Creates a new PositionHelper.
        Parameters:
        parentChildReorderMaxentModel - A maximum entropy model for <* as defined in Eq. 19 (Section 4.2.1 Modeling)
        leftMaxEnt - A maximum entropy model for <l as defined in Eq. 19 (Section 4.2.1 Modeling)
        rightMaxEnt - A maximum entropy model for <r as defined in Eq. 19 (Section 4.2.1 Modeling)

    • Method Detail

      • getNBestReorderings

        public List<edu.stanford.nlp.util.Pair<List<Edge>,Double>> getNBestReorderings(Amr amr,
                                                                               Vertex v,
                                                                               List<Edge> leftChildInsertions,
                                                                               String realization,
                                                                               String voice)
        Returns the n-best reorderings (according to takeBestN) for the outgoing edges of a vertex.
        Parameters:
        amr - the corresponding AMR graph
        v - the vertex to consider
        leftChildInsertions - the children inserted to the left of v
        realization - the realization of v
        voice - the voice of v. If v is a passive verb, this must be set to GoldSyntacticAnnotations.PASSIVE. Otherwise, it should be left empty or set to GoldSyntacticAnnotations.ACTIVE.
        Returns:
        a list containing the n-best reorderings along with their probabilities
